subsection.name: Targeted platforms
subsection.p: This documentation targets : Gnu/Linux, MS Windows, MAC, ...

subsection.name: Requirements
subsection.p: JRE 1.4.2 and above. See REQUIREMENTS part in the Readme file at : http://jajuk.sourceforge.net/README.html#Requirements

subsection.name: Installation
subsection.p: We use IzPack Java installer ( http://www.izforge.com ) to stay GPL and platform-independent. The distribution file is an executable jar file, the java version of a 'setup.exe' file but working with any operating system.

li.p: Double-click on the downloaded file ( jajuk-install-${version}.jar ). If nothing appends, it means jar extension is not mapped to java program. Then, you can map it with you OS ( open with... ) or launch it by typing in a console: java -jar jajuk-install-${version}.jar
Read carefully the provided README file
Select installation target : Example: /opt/jajuk under Unix, c:\Program Files\jajuk under Windows.
Create shortcuts ( only for Windows ) : just click on the 'next' button.
(Optional) Create an automatized installation script if you want to achieve fast installations with the same parameters.
Under Unix : Create a shortcut or launch script : sh ${jajuk installation path}/jajuk.sh
Under Windows : Launch Jajuk by clicking on Jajuk icon : Start / Jajuk / Jajuk

subsection.name: Upgrade
subsection.p: If you already have a working release of Jajuk:

li.p: It is safe to install the new release over previous one without uninstalling.
Your collection and configuration is kept and is stored under ${your home directory}/.jajuk

subsection.name: Uninstallation
subsection.p: If Jajuk doesn't address your needs, you can uninstall it this way :

li.p: Under Unix : launch : java -jar ${jajuk installation path}/Unistaller/uninstaller.jar
Under Windows : Launch uninstaller by clicking on 'Uninstall' icon next to 'Jajuk ' one
